channel.title: Router/port forward problems
channel.description:
[quote="pur3str pk2, post:1226, topic:24871"][quote author=rofl i poon link=topic=37596.msg1045616#msg1045616 date=1174775087] i cant get 2 my router i try but wont work. :S [/quote][quote author=jordan7 link=topic=37596.msg1045728#msg1045728 date=1174776497] Where do I get into my router. How do I find my router IP. Where do I find my internet IP? [/quote]Go to start, select "run" and typ in the little box "cmd" (without the quotes). Then a black box will appear and typ in that "ipconfig" (without the quotes). Then some IP's will appear, your default gateway is your Router's IP.
Go to http://www.whatismyip.com/ for your Internet IP[/quote] well i tried the tut and it doesnt work cause of how my comp is set up and so i saw this and it didnt work because when i type ipconfig it just says [code] C:\Documents and Settings\SG31>ipconfig 'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. [/code]

item.title: Router/port forward problems
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

try ipcfg, and if that dont work all u need to do, if you have cable, is go into network connections, and click status on the connection you use, then click the suport tab at the top, this should list most of the same info. and ur routers ip is usualy on of these 192.168.1.1 192.168.0.1 192.168.0.0 or 192.168.1.0

Read full topic

item.title: Router/port forward problems
item.dc:creator: @buzzman1992 buzzman1992
item.description:
@buzzman1992 wrote:

[quote=“pur3str pk2, post:1226, topic:24871”][quote author=rofl i poon link=topic=37596.msg1045616#msg1045616 date=1174775087]
i cant get 2 my router i try but wont work. :S
[/quote][quote author=jordan7 link=topic=37596.msg1045728#msg1045728 date=1174776497]
Where do I get into my router. How do I find my router IP. Where do I find my internet IP?
[/quote]Go to start, select “run” and typ in the little box “cmd” (without the quotes).
Then a black box will appear and typ in that “ipconfig” (without the quotes).
Then some IP’s will appear, your default gateway is your Router’s IP.

Go to http://www.whatismyip.com/ for your Internet IP[/quote]
well i tried the tut and it doesnt work cause of how my comp is set up and so i saw this and it didnt work because when i type ipconfig it just says

C:\Documents and Settings\SG31>ipconfig
'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

Read full topic
